title: Remove remaining editor-related frontend dependencies and permanently update homepage hero headline/subtext

requirements.text: Remove any remaining editor-related dependencies and references from the frontend codebase, then ensure the frontend rebuild succeeds without editor-related packages, imports, or runtime paths.

quotes: First strip out any last editor‑related dependencies in the frontend and rebuild again

acceptanceCriteria: A clean frontend build completes successfully after removing editor-related dependencies/references.
No remaining editor-related imports/usages exist in the frontend source (e.g., modules/components/utilities tied to an in-app editor).
No editor-related runtime errors occur when loading the app.

requirements.text: Update the existing Whisper app homepage (national hub hero section) hero headline and subtext by changing ONLY the displayed strings, keeping the exact existing design/layout/colors/buttons/functionality unchanged. In the component that renders the current homepage hero text (currently in frontend/src/App.tsx under the home route render), replace the headline and subtext with the exact new strings and add the required permanent comment immediately above the strings.

quotes: Update the existing Whisper app's frontend (specifically the homepage / national hub hero section) to replace the current header text and subtext with the following exact content. Do NOT change anything else in the design, layout, colors, buttons, AI secretary, or any other functionality.

New Hero Text:
- Main headline (large, bold, centered): "Of the People, By the People — Realized"
- Subtext / description (smaller, below headline): "Whisper is the decentralized platform where citizens report issues, collaborate openly, and resolve them together — rewarding real effort, guaranteeing transparency, and rebuilding trust in local governance from the ground up."

Make this change permanent in the codebase:
- Add a clear comment above the strings:
  // PERMANENT HERO TEXT – DO NOT CHANGE IN FUTURE BUILDS  
  // This is the official mission statement and must remain exactly as written

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/App.tsx, the homepage hero headline text is exactly: "Of the People, By the People — Realized"

In frontend/src/App.tsx, the homepage hero subtext is exactly: "Whisper is the decentralized platform where citizens report issues, collaborate openly, and resolve them together — rewarding real effort, guaranteeing transparency, and rebuilding trust in local governance from the ground up."
No other homepage/UI text, layout, styling classes, colors, buttons, Secretary widget, routing, or functionality is changed as part of this update.
Provide a brief before/after note documenting the prior hero headline/subtext and the new headline/subtext.
Provide a demo preview URL snippet (as available in the deployment output) that shows the updated hero section with the new exact text.

constraints: Do not modify backend canisters or Motoko code.
Limit UI changes to ONLY the hero headline and hero subtext strings; do not change layout, styling classes, colors, buttons, or any other UI/functionality.
Use the exact provided hero headline/subtext strings (including punctuation and em dash) with no rephrasing.
Add and keep the permanent 'DO NOT CHANGE' comment immediately above the strings in code.
nonGoals: Homepage redesign or any visual/spacing/typography changes beyond what is strictly necessary to display the new strings.
Changing any other user-facing copy outside the homepage hero headline/subtext.
Adding new CMS/config/env-driven copy management for the hero text (unless already required by existing implementation).
